channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-28269] Kubernetes test failed with permission denied

https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=37264&view=logs&j=bea52777-eaf8-5663-8482-18fbc3630e81&t=b2642e3a-5b86-574d-4c8a-f7e2842bfb14&l=4975
item.summary: Kubernetes test failed with permission denied

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: A quick Google search turned me to https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/issues/14403 - My assumption is that Azure has had an update which is now causing this error
yangwang166 rmetzger I've been doing some investigation on this but I do have one question: Do you know if it was it a deliberate decision to use the none driver over the other existing ones?

martijnvisser afaik yangwang166 introduced this code originally.
I assume the "none" driver was used for performance / efficiency reasons. Most of the disadvantages listed https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/drivers/none/ don't apply to CI environments.
